elements.text: Who all are eligible to open the account?

text:
Ujjivan Digital Accounts can be opened as long as



a. You are an Indian citizen


b. Have a valid PAN and Aadhaar number


c. Have a valid mobile number linked to your Aadhaar


d. You are above 18 years of age

elements.text: Can I open an account without providing my Aadhaar?

text: To open a Digital Account, you need to share your Aadhaar  PAN details. In case you do not wish to share your Aadhaar information, you can visit your nearest Ujjivan Bank and open any account from our range of products.

elements.text: What is a FATCA declaration and is it mandatory to declare it?

text: FATCA stands for the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act. The RBI requires us to collect a FATCA declaration from every customer who opens a savings bank account with us.

elements.text: Can I open a joint account through this channel?

text: Digital Account is intended only for one user and cannot be held jointly.

elements.text: How should I book an appointment for full KYC?

text:
You can fix an appointment to complete the full KYC through the following means -


While opening an account (online)


Through Internet and Mobile Banking


Through Phone Banking

elements.text: How can I fund my savings Account?

text:
You can add your Ujjivan Savings Account as a beneficiary in your other bank account using Account Number and IFSC and transfer funds to Ujjivan Bank Account via IMPS or NEFT


You can visit any UPI app on your smart phone and transfer the funds using A/C+IFSC


Alternatively, you can visit your nearest Ujjivan Small Finance Bank branch to deposit cheque of any other bank account.
